item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, November 18, 2024 at 11:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Launch HN: Regatta Storage (YC F24) – Turn S3 into a local-like, POSIX cloud FS (272 points | 186 comments)
2. DOJ will push Google to sell off Chrome (129 points | 82 comments)
3. Show HN: FastGraphRAG – Better RAG using good old PageRank (166 points | 54 comments)
4. MailCatcher runs a super simple SMTP server (103 points | 42 comments)
5. A BBC navigation bar component broke depending on the external monitor (179 points | 72 comments)
6. Fun facts about Google Scholar (126 points | 75 comments)
7. The Skyline algorithm for packing 2D rectangles (109 points | 25 comments)
8. Air traffic failure caused by two locations 3600nm apart sharing 3-letter code (125 points | 134 comments)
9. Bird brain from the age of dinosaurs reveals roots of avian intelligence (73 points | 4 comments)
10. Trieve (YC W24) Is Hiring a software engineer to build OpenAPI tooling ( | hide)
11. Show HN: Tips.io – A Tailwind playground with AI, page management, and theming (156 points | 42 comments)
12. Valve developers discuss why Half Life 2: Episode 3 was abandoned (32 points | 23 comments)
13. Waiting for many things at once with io_uring (49 points | 13 comments)
14. Reactive HTML Notebooks (273 points | 44 comments)
15. AMD Now Has More Compute on the Top500 Than Nvidia (92 points | 56 comments)
16. DNA testing company vanishes along with its customers' genetic data (38 points | 7 comments)
17. Towards Nyquist Learners (28 points | 19 comments)
18. LLaVA-O1: Let Vision Language Models Reason Step-by-Step (127 points | 23 comments)
19. Is Chrome the New IE? (2023) (155 points | 176 comments)
20. A programmable FPGA SoM in the tiny microSD form factor (56 points | 16 comments)
21. Extending the context length to 1M tokens (72 points | 93 comments)
22. Show HN: Nova JavaScript Engine (221 points | 91 comments)
23. JGS ASCII ART gallery (2001) (4 points | 1 comment)
24. Against Best Practices (189 points | 153 comments)
25. Show HN: Documind – Open-source AI tool to turn documents into structured data (140 points | 41 comments)
26. Libobscura (72 points | 4 comments)
27. Illegally logged wood from Cambodia likely ending up in U.S. homes (93 points | 59 comments)
28. An Uncanny Moat (6 points | 9 comments)
29. Microsoft starts boiling the Copilot frog: It's not a soup you want to drink (26 points | 1 comment)
30. End-to-End Tour of Text Layout/Rendering (2015) (7 points | discuss)
